storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive immediate alerts for overlapping bookings to prevent double-booking

testCases.title: Validate detection of overlapping bookings
preconditions: Scheduler is logged in with valid credentials and appropriate role-based permissions
Scheduling system is operational and accessible
At least one existing booking is present in the system (e.g., Resource A booked from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM)
Conflict detection service is running and responsive
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page in the scheduling system
steps.expectedResult: Booking creation page loads successfully with all required fields visible

steps.action: Enter booking details that overlap with the existing booking (same Resource A, time slot 10:30 AM to 11:30 AM)
steps.expectedResult: All booking details are entered successfully in the form fields

steps.action: Submit the booking request by clicking the 'Create Booking' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and detects the conflict within 1 second

steps.action: Observe the system response and alert mechanism
steps.expectedResult: System sends an immediate alert to the scheduler displaying conflict notification

steps.action: Review the alert content for conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler receives detailed conflict alert showing: conflicting resource name (Resource A), existing booking time (10:00 AM - 11:00 AM), new booking time (10:30 AM - 11:30 AM), overlap duration, and conflicting booking owner

steps.action: Attempt to confirm the booking by clicking 'Confirm' or 'Save' button while conflict is unresolved
steps.expectedResult: System prevents booking confirmation and displays message: 'Cannot confirm booking. Please resolve the conflict first.' Booking remains in draft or pending state

steps.action: Verify that the booking is not saved to the schedule
steps.expectedResult: The conflicting booking does not appear in the calendar view and is not persisted in the database

postconditions: Conflicting booking is not confirmed or saved in the system
Original existing booking remains unchanged
Conflict alert is displayed and logged
Scheduler is aware of the conflict and can take corrective action
System remains in a consistent state ready for next booking attempt

testCases.title: Verify conflict logging
preconditions: Scheduler is logged in with valid credentials
Scheduling system is operational
At least one existing booking is present in the system
Conflict logging service is enabled and functional
User has permissions to access conflict logs
System clock is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking creation page is displayed successfully

steps.action: Create a booking that conflicts with an existing booking (e.g., same resource and overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Booking details are entered and submitted successfully

steps.action: Observe the system response when conflict is detected
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict and triggers alert within 1 second

steps.action: Note the exact timestamp when the conflict was detected
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection timestamp is visible in the alert or system response

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict logs section or admin panel
steps.expectedResult: Conflict logs page loads successfully with search and filter options

steps.action: Search for the recently created conflict event using timestamp or user details
steps.expectedResult: Conflict event is found in the logs

steps.action: Review the logged conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Logs contain accurate conflict details including: timestamp of conflict detection, user ID and username of scheduler who attempted the booking, conflicting resource details, existing booking ID and details, attempted booking details, conflict type (overlap), and duration of overlap

steps.action: Verify the completeness and accuracy of logged information
steps.expectedResult: All required metadata is present and matches the actual conflict scenario. No data is missing or corrupted

postconditions: Conflict event is permanently logged in the system database
Log entry contains complete and accurate information for audit purposes
Log is accessible for future review and reporting
System maintains log integrity and consistency

testCases.title: Test alert UI display
preconditions: Scheduler is logged in with valid credentials
Scheduling system UI is fully loaded and responsive
At least one existing booking is present in the system
Browser supports all required UI components and JavaScript
Alert UI component is properly configured and enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking creation page is displayed with all form fields visible

steps.action: Enter booking details that will trigger a conflict (overlapping resource and time)
steps.expectedResult: Booking details are entered successfully

steps.action: Submit the booking to trigger conflict detection
steps.expectedResult: System processes the booking and detects the conflict within 1 second

steps.action: Observe the alert UI component that appears on screen
steps.expectedResult: Alert UI component is displayed prominently on the screen with clear visibility. Alert includes: conflict icon or visual indicator, conflict title/heading, detailed conflict information (resource name, time slots, conflicting booking details), timestamp of conflict detection, and action buttons (Acknowledge, View Details, Cancel)

steps.action: Verify the alert UI styling and positioning
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed in a modal or prominent notification area, uses appropriate color coding (e.g., red or orange for warning), text is readable and properly formatted, and alert does not obstruct critical UI elements

steps.action: Click on 'View Details' button in the alert
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict information is displayed showing full details of both the existing booking and the attempted booking, including participants, resources, and exact time overlap

steps.expectedResult: Scheduler successfully acknowledges the alert. Alert UI updates to show acknowledged status or closes gracefully. System records the acknowledgment action with timestamp

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to support conflict detection across multiple scheduling calendars to ensure comprehensive conflict management

testCases.title: Detect conflicts across multiple calendars
preconditions: Scheduler is logged in with valid credentials and cross-calendar access permissions
Multiple calendars are configured in the system (minimum 2 calendars: e.g., Team A Calendar and Team B Calendar)
Each calendar has at least one existing booking
Cross-calendar conflict detection service is enabled and operational
All calendars are synchronized and accessible
Test data includes a shared resource that can be booked across multiple calendars

steps.action: Navigate to Team A Calendar and create a booking for a shared resource (e.g., Conference Room 1) from 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM
steps.expectedResult: Booking is created successfully in Team A Calendar and saved to the system

steps.action: Navigate to Team B Calendar
steps.expectedResult: Team B Calendar loads successfully showing existing bookings

steps.action: Attempt to create a booking in Team B Calendar for the same shared resource (Conference Room 1) with overlapping time slot from 2:30 PM to 3:30 PM
steps.expectedResult: Booking details are entered in the form

steps.action: Submit the booking request
steps.expectedResult: System detects cross-calendar conflict involving Conference Room 1 booked in both Team A and Team B calendars within 2 seconds

steps.action: Review the conflict alert that appears
steps.expectedResult: Alert accurately reflects all conflicting bookings showing: source calendar (Team A Calendar), conflicting booking details (Conference Room 1, 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM), target calendar (Team B Calendar), attempted booking details (Conference Room 1, 2:30 PM - 3:30 PM), overlap period (2:30 PM - 3:00 PM), and resource name (Conference Room 1)

steps.action: Note the conflict details and navigate back to Team B Calendar booking form
steps.expectedResult: Booking form remains open with conflict alert visible

steps.action: Modify the booking time in Team B Calendar to a non-conflicting time slot (e.g., 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Booking details are updated successfully

steps.action: Submit the modified booking request
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and detects no conflicts across all calendars

steps.action: Confirm the booking
steps.expectedResult: Booking is confirmed and saved successfully in Team B Calendar. Conflict alert is cleared and no longer displayed

steps.action: Verify both calendars show correct bookings without conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Team A Calendar shows Conference Room 1 booked from 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM. Team B Calendar shows Conference Room 1 booked from 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM. No conflict indicators are present

postconditions: Cross-calendar conflict was successfully detected and alerted
Conflict was resolved by modifying the booking time
Both calendars contain valid, non-conflicting bookings
Shared resource (Conference Room 1) is properly allocated across calendars
Conflict alert is cleared from the system
All calendar data is synchronized and consistent

testCases.title: Verify conflict detection latency with multiple calendars
preconditions: Scheduler is logged in with valid credentials
Multiple calendars are configured and operational (minimum 3 calendars for comprehensive testing)
Each calendar contains multiple existing bookings to simulate realistic load
Cross-calendar conflict detection service is running
System performance monitoring tools are available or timer is ready
At least one shared resource exists across multiple calendars
Network latency is within normal operational parameters

steps.action: Prepare a stopwatch or note the system timestamp before initiating the booking
steps.expectedResult: Timer is ready to measure conflict detection latency

steps.action: Navigate to any calendar (e.g., Calendar C) in the system
steps.expectedResult: Calendar C loads successfully

steps.action: Identify a resource that is already booked in a different calendar (e.g., Projector X booked in Calendar A from 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Existing booking information is confirmed in Calendar A

steps.action: Start the timer and immediately input a booking in Calendar C for the same resource (Projector X) with overlapping time (1:30 PM to 2:30 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Booking details are entered and form is ready for submission

steps.action: Submit the booking request and continue timing
steps.expectedResult: Booking request is submitted to the system for processing

steps.action: Observe when the conflict alert appears and stop the timer
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected and alert is displayed. Elapsed time from submission to alert display is recorded

steps.action: Verify the measured latency
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection latency is under 2 seconds. Alert appears within the acceptable performance threshold

steps.action: Review the conflict alert content
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays accurate cross-calendar conflict information including: source calendar (Calendar A), conflicting resource (Projector X), existing booking time (1:00 PM - 2:00 PM), attempted booking calendar (Calendar C), attempted booking time (1:30 PM - 2:30 PM), and overlap duration (30 minutes)

steps.action: Repeat the test with bookings across different calendar combinations (e.g., Calendar B to Calendar C, Calendar A to Calendar B)
steps.expectedResult: Each test iteration detects conflicts within 2 seconds consistently across all calendar combinations

steps.action: Document the latency measurements for all test iterations
steps.expectedResult: All recorded latencies are under 2 seconds, demonstrating consistent performance with multiple calendars

postconditions: Conflict detection latency has been measured and verified to be under 2 seconds
System performance meets the specified requirements for cross-calendar conflict detection
Multiple test iterations confirm consistent performance
Test bookings can be cleaned up or cancelled
System remains responsive and operational
Performance metrics are documented for reporting

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to log all detected conflicts with detailed metadata to support audit and analysis

testCases.title: Verify conflict logging with metadata
preconditions: User is authenticated with scheduler role
Conflict detection system is operational
Conflict log database is accessible
API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/logs is available
At least two overlapping bookings exist to trigger a conflict

steps.action: Create or trigger a scheduling conflict by attempting to book a resource that is already reserved for the same time slot
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and triggers conflict detection mechanism

steps.action: Verify that the conflict is logged in the conflict log database
steps.expectedResult: Conflict entry is created with complete metadata including timestamp (date and time of conflict detection), user ID of the user who triggered the conflict, resource ID involved in the conflict, and booking details

steps.action: Send GET request to /api/conflicts/logs endpoint to query the conflict logs
steps.expectedResult: API returns the conflict logs with all metadata fields populated correctly

steps.action: Measure the response time of the API query
steps.expectedResult: Logs are returned within 3 seconds with complete metadata including timestamp, user information, resource details, and conflict status

steps.action: Verify the completeness of logged metadata fields
steps.expectedResult: All required fields are present: conflict ID, timestamp, user ID, resource ID, booking IDs involved, conflict type, and resolution status

postconditions: Conflict is logged in the database with complete metadata
Conflict log is queryable via API
System remains in operational state
No data corruption or loss occurred

testCases.title: Test access control for conflict logs
preconditions: Conflict logs exist in the database
API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/logs is available
Test user accounts with different roles are configured (authorized and unauthorized)
Authentication and authorization mechanisms are active
Role-based access control (RBAC) is properly configured

steps.action: Authenticate as a user without authorized role (e.g., regular user or guest role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated but does not have admin or scheduler privileges

steps.action: Attempt to access conflict logs by sending GET request to /api/conflicts/logs endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with HTTP 403 Forbidden status code and appropriate error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify that no conflict log data is returned in the response
steps.expectedResult: Response body does not contain any conflict log information or sensitive data

steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated with proper authorization credentials

steps.action: Verify the conflict logs are returned in the response
steps.expectedResult: Logs are accessible and returned with complete metadata within 3 seconds

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempts are logged for security audit
Access control mechanisms remain intact
Authorized users can successfully access logs
No security vulnerabilities exposed

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to prevent booking confirmation when conflicts exist to avoid scheduling errors

testCases.title: Block booking confirmation when conflict exists
preconditions: User is authenticated with scheduler role
Scheduling system is operational
API endpoint POST /api/schedule/confirm is available
A booking exists that conflicts with the booking to be confirmed
Conflict detection service is running and functional
Test booking is in pending/unconfirmed state

steps.action: Create or select a booking that has a scheduling conflict with an existing confirmed booking (same resource, overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Booking is created in pending state with known conflict

steps.action: Attempt to confirm the conflicting booking by sending POST request to /api/schedule/confirm with the booking ID
steps.expectedResult: System performs real-time conflict check before processing confirmation

steps.action: Verify the system response to the confirmation attempt
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the confirmation action and returns an error response with HTTP 409 Conflict status code

steps.action: Review the error message returned by the system
steps.expectedResult: Clear error message is displayed detailing the conflict including conflicting resource, time slot, and existing booking information

steps.action: Verify the booking status remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Booking remains in pending/unconfirmed state and is not confirmed

steps.action: Resolve the conflict by modifying the booking (change time slot or resource to eliminate overlap)
steps.expectedResult: Booking is updated successfully with no conflicts detected

steps.action: Retry the confirmation by sending POST request to /api/schedule/confirm with the updated booking ID
steps.expectedResult: System performs conflict check and finds no conflicts

steps.action: Verify the confirmation is successful
steps.expectedResult: Booking is confirmed successfully with HTTP 200 OK status, booking status changes to confirmed, and confirmation details are returned

postconditions: Conflicting booking was blocked from confirmation
Resolved booking is successfully confirmed
Schedule integrity is maintained
No double-booking or scheduling errors occurred
Audit trail of confirmation attempts is logged

steps.action: Prepare a valid booking confirmation request with booking ID that has no conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Request payload is properly formatted and ready to submit

steps.action: Record the timestamp before sending the confirmation request

steps.action: Submit booking confirmation request by sending POST request to /api/schedule/confirm endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Request is sent successfully to the server

steps.action: Wait for and receive the response from the server
steps.expectedResult: Server processes the request and returns a response

steps.action: Record the timestamp when the response is received
steps.expectedResult: End time is captured accurately

steps.action: Verify that the response time is under 2 seconds

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to support concurrent scheduling inputs without missing conflict detections to maintain data integrity

testCases.title: Ensure conflict detection under concurrent booking submissions
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Database has transaction support enabled
Test environment supports at least 100 concurrent connections
Multiple scheduler accounts are created and authenticated
Test data includes resources with defined availability schedules
Performance monitoring tools are configured to track concurrent operations
API endpoint POST /api/schedule/book is available and functional

steps.action: Prepare 100 booking requests with intentionally overlapping time slots for the same resources
steps.expectedResult: 100 booking payloads are created with overlapping times (e.g., 50 requests for Resource A from 10:00-11:00, 50 requests for Resource B from 14:00-15:00)

steps.action: Initiate concurrent submission of all 100 booking requests simultaneously using load testing tool or multi-threaded script
steps.expectedResult: All 100 requests are sent to the system within a 1-2 second window

steps.action: Monitor system response for each booking submission request
steps.expectedResult: System processes all 100 requests and returns responses for each submission

steps.action: Analyze responses to verify conflict detection - check for conflict alerts/errors for overlapping bookings
steps.expectedResult: System detects all conflicts accurately: only 1 booking per resource per time slot is accepted, remaining 49 requests for each resource receive conflict error messages

steps.action: Query the database to retrieve all bookings created during the concurrent submission test
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns only the successfully created bookings without conflicts

steps.action: Verify no bookings were created with unresolved conflicts by checking each booking against the resource availability schedule
steps.expectedResult: No conflicting bookings are persisted in the database - each resource has only one booking per time slot with no overlaps

steps.action: Review system logs and transaction records for any race conditions or deadlock errors
steps.expectedResult: Logs show proper transaction handling with no race conditions, deadlocks, or data integrity errors

steps.action: Verify the count of successful bookings matches expected results (2 successful bookings for 2 resources)
steps.expectedResult: Exactly 2 bookings are confirmed (1 per resource), and 98 requests were rejected with appropriate conflict messages

postconditions: Only non-conflicting bookings are persisted in the database
All conflict errors are logged appropriately
System remains stable and responsive after concurrent load
No data corruption or inconsistencies exist in the scheduling database
All rejected booking requests have clear conflict error messages recorded

testCases.title: Verify data consistency during concurrent operations
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational with transaction support enabled
Database is in a known consistent state with existing bookings
Multiple scheduler accounts are authenticated and have appropriate permissions
Test environment supports concurrent operations (minimum 50 concurrent users)
Baseline data snapshot is taken for comparison
API endpoints POST /api/schedule/book and DELETE /api/schedule/cancel are functional
Monitoring tools are configured to track data consistency metrics

steps.action: Create initial set of 25 confirmed bookings across various resources and time slots
steps.expectedResult: 25 bookings are successfully created and persisted in the database with confirmed status

steps.action: Take a snapshot of the current database state including all booking records, resource availability, and timestamps
steps.expectedResult: Database snapshot captured showing 25 confirmed bookings with all associated metadata

steps.action: Prepare concurrent operations: 25 new booking requests and 15 cancellation requests for existing bookings
steps.expectedResult: 40 total operations are prepared (25 create, 15 cancel) targeting different and some overlapping resources

steps.action: Execute all 40 operations concurrently using multi-threaded approach to simulate real-world concurrent scheduler activity
steps.expectedResult: All 40 operations are submitted to the system simultaneously within a 2-3 second window

steps.action: Monitor and collect responses from all concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: System returns response for each of the 40 operations with appropriate success or error status codes

steps.action: Query the database to retrieve current state of all bookings after concurrent operations complete
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns complete list of all bookings with their current status

steps.action: Verify data consistency by checking: (a) All successful cancellations are reflected in database, (b) All successful new bookings are persisted, (c) No phantom bookings exist, (d) Resource availability is correctly updated
steps.expectedResult: Data remains consistent with no anomalies: cancelled bookings are removed or marked cancelled, new valid bookings are confirmed, no duplicate or orphaned records exist, resource availability accurately reflects current bookings

steps.action: Perform referential integrity check to ensure all foreign key relationships are maintained
steps.expectedResult: All booking records have valid references to resources, schedulers, and related entities with no broken relationships

steps.action: Compare final database state with expected state based on successful operations
steps.expectedResult: Final booking count and resource availability matches expected calculations: (25 initial + successful new bookings - successful cancellations)

steps.action: Review transaction logs for any rollback operations, deadlocks, or consistency violations
steps.expectedResult: Transaction logs show proper atomic operations with appropriate rollbacks for failed transactions and no data consistency violations

steps.action: Verify audit trail completeness for all operations performed
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs contain complete records of all 40 operations with timestamps, user information, and operation outcomes

postconditions: Database maintains complete data consistency with no anomalies
All successful bookings are persisted correctly
All successful cancellations are reflected in the system
No orphaned or duplicate records exist
Resource availability accurately reflects current booking state
System remains stable and responsive
All operations are properly logged in audit trail
